subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] new course for MemRise; new decks for ANKI
msgSnippet: ... From: Ben Logan trybloganatgmail@yahoo.com [Read_Alphabet]  To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
messageBody:
----- Original message -----
From: "Ben Logan trybloganatgmail@... [Read_Alphabet]" <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com>
To: "Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com" <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] new course for MemRise; new decks for ANKI
Date: Wed, 30 Sep 2015 17:22:56 +0000 (UTC)
Alright!  Well, right there you've given me plenty!  I will almost certainly want to pepper this discussion group with questions for you, if you don't mind.
 
One question is, what software did you use for creating or modifying the fonts?
I used Font Forge. It's glitchy, and the person who developed it even says so himself. It crashes a lot. It has a whole lot of features, but they don't all work. But it's free, while the others cost hundreds of dollars.
 
Another,  well that special uppercase key ("pipe") is not mapped to the "awe" letter.  It's just pipe.  Now, really, I could probably go a long time without it.
Make sure you've downloaded version 3.3 of the font. Just now I deleted the older version, which you might have downloaded. I just now downloaded the copy of version 3.3 that's hosted in Files>Fonts, and verified that it does have the "awe" letter on that key.
 

I forgot to ask something:  do you have longer passages written in Suave QS?  If not, I would like if I gave you--say--a page of all that on occasion for review.  I just want to make sure I'm going in the right direction.

Okay, I'm sending a few files to you.
 
Be Well,
 
Scott
